verses.kjv: A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet upon Shigionoth.
verses.ct: A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet, set to Shigionoth.

verses.kjv: O LORD, I have heard thy speech, and was afraid: O LORD, revive thy work in the midst of the years, in the midst of the years make known; in wrath remember mercy.
verses.ct: LORD, I have heard your message, and I stand in awe. LORD, bring your work back to life in our time — make it known in our day. Even in your anger, remember mercy.

verses.kjv: God came from Teman, and the Holy One from mount Paran. Selah. His glory covered the heavens, and the earth was full of his praise.
verses.ct: God came from Teman, the Holy One from Mount Paran. Selah. His glory filled the heavens, and the earth was full of his praise.

verses.kjv: And his brightness was as the light; he had horns coming out of his hand: and there was the hiding of his power.
verses.ct: His radiance was like sunlight; rays flashed from his hand, where his power was concealed.

verses.kjv: Before him went the pestilence, and burning coals went forth at his feet.
verses.ct: Plague went ahead of him, and disease followed close behind.

verses.kjv: He stood, and measured the earth: he beheld, and drove asunder the nations; and the everlasting mountains were scattered, the perpetual hills did bow: his ways are everlasting.
verses.ct: He stood and shook the earth; he looked and made the nations tremble. The ancient mountains crumbled, and the age-old hills collapsed — yet his paths are eternal.

verses.kjv: I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction: and the curtains of the land of Midian did tremble.
verses.ct: I saw the camps of Cushan in distress; the shelters of Midian's land were shaking.

verses.kjv: Was the LORD displeased against the rivers? was thine anger against the rivers? was thy wrath against the sea, that thou didst ride upon thine horses and thy chariots of salvation?
verses.ct: Were you angry at the rivers, LORD? Was your fury directed at the rivers? Was your rage against the sea, when you rode out on your horses and your chariots of salvation?

verses.kjv: Thy bow was made quite naked, according to the oaths of the tribes, even thy word. Selah. Thou didst cleave the earth with rivers.
verses.ct: You drew your bow and readied it, fulfilling the sworn promises to the tribes — your word. Selah. You split the earth open with rivers.

verses.kjv: The mountains saw thee, and they trembled: the overflowing of the water passed by: the deep uttered his voice, and lifted up his hands on high.
verses.ct: The mountains saw you and writhed in pain. Torrents of water rushed past; the deep ocean roared and raised its waves high.

verses.kjv: The sun and moon stood still in their habitation: at the light of thine arrows they went, and at the shining of thy glittering spear.
verses.ct: The sun and moon stopped in their place; they fled at the flash of your arrows, at the gleam of your shining spear.

verses.kjv: Thou didst march through the land in indignation, thou didst thresh the heathen in anger.
verses.ct: You marched across the earth in fury; you trampled the nations in anger.

verses.kjv: Thou wentest forth for the salvation of thy people, even for salvation with thine anointed; thou woundedst the head out of the house of the wicked, by discovering the foundation unto the neck. Selah.
verses.ct: You went out to rescue your people, to save your anointed one. You crushed the leader of the wicked household, stripping him bare from head to foot. Selah.

verses.kjv: Thou didst strike through with his staves the head of his villages: they came out as a whirlwind to scatter me: their rejoicing was as to devour the poor secretly.
verses.ct: With his own weapons you pierced the heads of his warriors, who stormed in like a whirlwind to scatter me — gloating as though they were devouring the helpless in secret.

verses.kjv: Thou didst walk through the sea with thine horses, through the heap of great waters.
verses.ct: You trampled through the sea with your horses, churning through the mighty waters.

verses.kjv: When I heard, my belly trembled; my lips quivered at the voice: rottenness entered into my bones, and I trembled in myself, that I might rest in the day of trouble: when he cometh up unto the people, he will invade them with his troops.
verses.ct: When I heard all this, my insides churned; my lips quivered at the sound. Decay crept into my bones, and my legs trembled beneath me. Yet I will wait quietly for the day of distress to come upon the nation that attacks us.

verses.kjv: Although the fig tree shall not blossom, neither shall fruit be in the vines; the labour of the olive shall fail, and the fields shall yield no meat; the flock shall be cut off from the fold, and there shall be no herd in the stalls:
verses.ct: Even if the fig tree doesn't bloom and the grapevines produce nothing, even if the olive crop fails and the fields grow no food, even if the sheep disappear from the pen and no cattle remain in the stalls —

verses.kjv: Yet I will rejoice in the LORD, I will joy in the God of my salvation.
verses.ct: still, I will celebrate the LORD; I will find my joy in the God who saves me.

verses.kjv: The LORD God is my strength, and he will make my feet like hinds’ feet, and he will make me to walk upon mine high places. To the chief singer on my stringed instruments.
verses.ct: The Lord GOD is my strength. He makes my feet sure like a deer's, and he enables me to walk on the heights. For the music director: to be accompanied by stringed instruments.
